variant-analysis/tb-variant-analysis/tut.description: Variation in the genome of M. tuberculosis (Mtb) is associated with changes in phenotype, for example drug resistance and virulence. It is also useful for outbreak investigation as the single nucleotide polymorphisms (SNPs) in a sample can be used to build a phylogeny.
variant-analysis/tb-variant-analysis/tut.title: M. tuberculosis Variant Analysis

webinar/tb-drug-resistance.title: Webinar: Drug resistance prediction
webinar/tb-drug-resistance.description: Principles of drug resistance detection from genomic data

webinar/tb-clustering.title: Webinar: The Concept of Clustering
webinar/tb-clustering.description: Main aspects of clustering analysis to infer transmission in MTBC

webinar/tb-phylogenetic-mutations.title: Webinar: Phylogenetic mutations
webinar/tb-phylogenetic-mutations.description: This video will introduce one special type of mutations to take into account when studying drug resistance patterns

webinar/tb-genetic-distance.title: Webinar: genetic distance thresholds
webinar/tb-genetic-distance.description: Clustering as an approximation to infer transmission
